ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject

Class TunnelFollower

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.finalproject.TunnelFollower

  • public class TunnelFollower
extends java.lang.Object
    This class prepares for, and executes tunnel traversal. It computes the entrance and exit points of the tunnel, as well as the direction to turn in order to localize before and after crossing.
    Author:
    Anthony Laye, Mai Zeng

    • Method Detail

      • traverseTunnel

        public void traverseTunnel(double startX,
                  double startY,
                  double endX,
                  double endY,
                  double IslandURX,
                  double IslandURY,
                  double IslandLLX,
                  double IslandLLY,
                  double myZoneURX,
                  double myZoneURY,
                  double myZoneLLX,
                  double myZoneLLY,
                  double TNRURX,
                  double TNRURY,
                  double TNRLLX,
                  double TNRLLY)
        This method prepares the robot to traverse the tunnel. It may raise or lower the arms to ensure safe passage. First, it calculates the entry and exit coordinates of the tunnel: there are set to be the center of the tiles right before and right after the tunnel. From these, we can determine if the tunnel is oriented horizontally or vertically, and determine which entrance of the tunnel the robot will enter and exit from. Once done, we travel to the starting position and localize before the tunnel. There are 4 key parameters for tunnel localization: angle1, angle2, x_corr and y_corr. Angle 1 and 2 are the angles the robot must turn to to seek for a line. The correction values corrects the odometer once these lines are found. Once passed the bridge, the robot localizes again with slightly different parameters to account for changes in direction.
        Parameters:
        startX - : x position before tunnel
        startY - : y position before tunnel
        endX - : x position after tunnel
        endY - : y position after tunnel
        IslandURX - : upper right x coordinate of the island
        IslandURY - : upper right y coordinate of the island
        IslandLLX - : lower left x coordinate of the island
        IslandLLY - : lower left y coordinate of the island
        myZoneURX - : upper right x coordinate of our robot's zone
        myZoneURY - : upper right y coordinate of our robot's zone
        myZoneLLX - : lower left x coordinate of our robot's zone
        myZoneLLY - : lower left y coordinate of our robot's done
        TNRURX - : upper right x coordinate of the tunnel
        TNRURY - : upper right y coordinate of the tunnel
        TNRLLX - : lower left x coordinate of the tunnel
        TNRLLY - : lower left y coordinate of the tunnel
        isTravelingBack - : determines if robot is traveling back to starting point, or traveling to tree

      • getTheEntry

        public double[] getTheEntry(double myZoneURX,
                   double myZoneURY,
                   double myZoneLLX,
                   double myZoneLLY,
                   double tNRURX,
                   double tNRURY,
                   double tNRLLX,
                   double tNRLLY,
                   double islandURX,
                   double islandURY,
                   double islandLLX,
                   double islandLLY)
        This method calculates the entry point of the tunnel. This is used so that the robot stops half a tile before the entrance so it can re-localize itself before traversal.
        Parameters:
        myZoneURX - : upper right x coordinate of the robot's zone
        myZoneURY - : upper right y coordinate of the robot's zone
        myZoneLLX - : lower left x coordinate of the robot's zone
        myZoneLLY - : lower left y coordinate of the robot's zone
        tNRURX - : upper right x coordinate of the tunnel
        tNRURY - : upper right y coordinate of the tunnel
        tNRLLX - : lower left x coordinate of the tunnel
        tNRLLY - : lower left y coordinate of the tunnel
        islandURX - : upper right x coordinate of the island
        islandURY - : upper right y coordinate of the island
        islandLLX - : lower left x coordinate of the island
        islandLLY - : lower left y coordinate of the island
        Returns:
        array : array of modified tunnel coordinates
